title: Overall [0â€“9]
stimulusHtml:
9 points

Use EITHER the regular scoring guide OR one of the alternate scoring guides below.

I. Regular Scoring Guide

Score 1 point for each half-measure correct in both pitch and rhythm, and add one point to the total. For example, a response which is correct in all aspects receives a score of 8 + 1, or 9.

N.B. "Half-measures" may be considered to be any three contiguous eighth-note beats that are metrically correct, even if occurring over a bar line.

N.B. For the last pitch, a quarter note followed by an eighth rest will also be considered correct.

II. Alternate Scoring Guides (If you use an alternate scoring guide, do not add the extra point to the total.)

  1. If five or more half-measures of the rhythm are incorrect, award 1/2 point per half-measure of correct pitches.
    OR

  2. If five or more half-measures of the pitches are incorrect, award 1/4 point per half-measure of correct rhythm.

III. Rounding Fractional Scores

  1. Half-point totals should be rounded down with one exception: a total score of 1 1/2 should be rounded up to 2.

  2. Quarter points should be rounded to the closest integer.

IV. Scores with additional meaning

1 This score may also be used for responses which have less than one half-measure correct in both pitch and rhythm but which have some redeeming qualities. (Do not add the extra point!)

0 A response which demonstrates an attempt to answer the question but which has no redeeming qualities.
